p: The reason for these discrepancies between the model-based classification and the simple cutoff is that MAYV and CHIKV have contrasting risk factors for infection: males (respectively, females) are more exposed to MAYV (respectively, CHIKV). Many children and women infected by CHIKV in the urban areas are tested positive for MAYV with the simple cutoff, therefore leading to estimate that MAYV was recent and urban in French Guiana.
